errors.reasoning: Medium-sized feature PR (24 files, docs+agents categories) with active discussion showing complementary approaches rather than conflict. Author engagement with community (pauloportella responds constructively). However, first-time contributor with 0 prior merge rate and multiple greptile comments suggest iterative review. Size (24 files) is moderate risk but not extreme.

Strong signals: (1) has_maintainer_label=true (90.7% merge rate baseline), (2) author joshp123 has 100% prior merge rate (3/3), (3) maintainer has already merged via fast-forward (visible in comments: 'Merged to main via fast-forward'), (4) positive testing/validation from contributors (jiulingyun), (5) active maintainer engagement. Draft status is minor negative but overridden by other signals.

Strong positive signals: (1) Maintainer (sebslight/MEMBER) actively engaged and closed with implicit approval pattern. (2) Author responded to greptile-apps review with acceptable fix (updated to ^2026.2.1). (3) Fixes critical user-facing bug ('current release is actually broken for users'). (4) Single file change (low risk). (5) Greptile review shows engagement. Slight concern: first-time contributor, but maintainer participation + bug-fix criticality + responsive iteration suggests merge.

Author has 7 prior PRs with 14.3% merge rate (above first-time baseline but below median). Category 'agents' is top category (strong). Only 1 comment from member. Greptile raised concern but single file review suggests minor issue. Tests present. Size appears small. Below-average author merge rate is significant negative, but specificity of fix (rate limit before context overflow) and test coverage are positive.

First-time contributor with focused Telegram fix (3 files, metadata preservation during debounce). Has Greptile + Codex automated reviews suggesting bot engagement. Telegram is high-volume channel (347 PRs in dataset). No approval yet but reviews indicate scrutiny. Narrow scope + channel label + bot reviews push above baseline (24%), though first-time author status and lack of explicit approval creates uncertainty.

Minimal, focused fix (2 files, preferred solution per maintainer). Supersedes #2395. Small scope targets specific OpenRouter model reference bug. Author has 4 prior PRs (zero merge history, but focused scope overcomes this). No CI failures noted. XS/S category historically stronger. Greptile review present but no blocking feedback.

Single-file bug fix with clear business justification (batch jobs failing due to insufficient error context). Minimal scope (1 file) in agents category (top merge category at 1161 PRs). Author provided context: model lacks error explanation. No blocking CI/conflict signals. Low complexity + clear value = merge likely.

Single-file targeted fix in commands category. Symlink resolution issue in doctor command is narrow, low-risk change. No CI failures, no conflicts noted. First-time contributor but scope is minimal and focused. Maintainer engagement pattern absent (no blocking signals).

Mixed signals: (1) Author is contributor with 50% prior merge rate (1/2 PRs merged), suggesting competence. (2) Responsive to greptile-apps feedback—added fallback parsing and hardened logic. (3) Focused scope (5 files, commands category). (4) Maintenance-heavy activity (rebases, CI retriggers) suggests genuine effort to unblock. Concern: 6 comments + multiple rebase iterations suggest complexity/conflict. No explicit maintainer approval yet. Slight lean toward merge due to author track record + fixes to review comments.

APPROVED by realmikewestfall304-wq (reviewer signal). Agents category, narrow scope (3 files, shell-utils), has test coverage. Negative: author Zazarothh has 0% merge rate (8 PRs), but approval + narrow fix scope + Windows-specific issue fix outweighs. Greptile review present (neutral).

Experienced author with 66.7% prior merge rate (2/3 PRs merged). Small scope (2 files, agents category). Focused on skills metadata parsing. Greptile review present but no major blockers evident. Above-baseline merge likelihood for established contributors.

First-time contributor but demonstrates high engagement: 6 comments with detailed technical explanations and proactive communication with maintainers. Author explicitly states 'This PR is ready for merge. All required CI checks pass (lint, build, test, windows, android)'. Greptile unable to review due to access, but author's responses show competence. Single file modification minimizes risk. Channel: line is moderate-priority channel. Author shows persistence addressing CI concerns.

Large XL PR (24 files) with heavy engagement (32 comments, 48 reviews). Author is engaged CONTRIBUTOR actively addressing Greptile review comments across 4+ review cycles, demonstrating commitment and iterative fixes (GCP validation, Zod schema alignment, error typing). Multi-category (docs, gateway, cli) indicates broad scope. High comment + maintainer engagement signals quality iteration, but XL size penalizes merge likelihood. Greptile review presence and author responsiveness pushes above 50% baseline despite size risk.

First-time contributor adding new AI provider (AIsa) with multi-category coverage (docs, commands, agents). 13 files is moderate scope. Feature addition to core provider system likely valuable for user base. Greptile review present. However, 0% prior merge rate as first-time author creates uncertainty. No explicit maintainer engagement yet, but provider additions are common merge candidates.

Strong merge signals: (1) author lailoo has solid 32.1% merge rate (9/28), (2) size:S label historically stronger, (3) maintainer comment indicates successful merge upstream: 'now merged' + references #14786 with full implementation details, (4) feature is GLM-5 forward-compat which is model infrastructure (strategic), (5) greptile reviewed. Comment from steipete (CONTRIBUTOR) explicitly states '(now merged)' — this PR appears to have already merged or superseded by #14786.

First-time contributor but minimal risk: single file change in gateway/server-methods. Fixes specific issue ('/new command not working in Control UI WebChat'). Categories gateway (578 PRs) and web-ui (336 PRs) are both high-volume. Size: S. Only 1 review from greptile (comment-only, no blocking concerns visible). No negative author signals. Clean scope suggests straightforward fix.

First-time contributor but addresses critical infrastructure: 'load rolling compaction extension and re-enable SDK compaction'. Category 'agents' is top priority (1161 PRs). Size: M with 9 files is substantial but coherent scope (all compaction-related). Spec document updated (SPEC-ROLLING-CONTEXT.md) indicates deliberate design work. No reviews yet but PR appears complete and well-structured. Touches extensions but within defined scope (compaction-rolling).

First-time contributor (0 prior PRs, 0% merge rate), no approval/merge history. Gateway+web-ui, M-size scope (2 files, test included). Greptile flagged (comment present). Baseline: 24% merge. First-timers typically 10-15%. No author engagement, no approval signal. Moderate probability of closure due to triage/quality.

Positive signals: (1) author MisterGuy420 has strong 60% merge rate (6/10), (2) size:S, (3) has_trusted_contributor_label=true, (4) files are documentation/config (AGENTS.md, BOOTSTRAP.md, etc.) — low-risk changes. Minimal concern: (1) no comments/reviews visible but doc-only PRs often skip review, (2) description is vague ('fix: short description'). Trust signal from high prior merge rate + trusted-contributor label outweighs lack of visibility.
